title: Tab automatically opens and then closes within 1 second.  REASON & FIX?
content:
With FF 140.0 on both WIn10 and WIn11, new tabs opened automatically then closed after less than a second. Initially I thought this was due to malware, but on inspecting the History, I found the source of this annoying behavior:

// SidebarUtil.tab.js

// This is just a placeholder file to be loaded in a temporary tab to check if a sidebar is open and how wide it is.

Is there a way to STOP this sidebar checking with its tab opening/closing without disabling Java entirely ? Is this annoying behavior really necessary in FF ?

title: Is there a way to disable AI tag grouping before it rolls out to my device?
content:
I don't know about you, but I loathe the recent push by the majority of tech companies to integrate the wasteful and environmentally harmful technology that is Generative AI into every corner of the digital landscape. I am especially disappointed in Firefox following the Gen AI hype and inserting it into our experiences as a default without considering the massive amount of users who are not interested in this tech for morons, those who want nothing to do with said tech, or people like myself who f***ing hate it. I am aware that you can shut off AI features by using Firefox's advanced configuration, so I'm wondering if such an option already exists for this coming rollout feature.

I for one believe Firefox should give its users the option to preemptively opt out of rollout features for things involving Gen AI which many, like me, are in vocal opposition against.

title: Flatpak - No embedded Media/Video Playback
content:
Since Flathub list the org.mozilla.firefox app as official, i hope this is the correct support channel.

Recently i switched from distro specific package managers to flatpak as my application provider. The firefox flatpak won't play most embedded Video/Media on applications like in-browser fediverse clients, forums, blogs or wikis. Youtube works without any issues, Twitch is fine until there is an adbreak. Then it sometimes stops with the supported format/mime error (screenshot appended), only recoverable by cache-dismissive reload.

I used this Article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/audio-and-video-firefox and the links it contains to debug without any success. None of these samples play. just shows supported format/mime error https://test-videos.co.uk/bigbuckbunny/mp4-h265 At this test website 1. and 3. example won't play. I provided a screenshot before and after trying to click play on all the examples. https://www.tekeye.uk/html/html5-video-test-page

Contrary to the observed behavior about:support#media claims Software Decoding supported for everything except HEVC.

Chromium Flatpak has no such issues. So i copy the video url and play it with chromium. You can see: dire times.
creator: ea8e27aa-3e5c-4e3f-89df-317234589d08

title: Change Position of the Buttons Print, Save, Open in dialog windows
content:
Hello, I freshly installed my new computer and so my thunderbird version is now newer than before. I use Debian 12 with Thunderbird and Firefox 128.13.0esr now. I do unfortunately not know which version I had before, but I think my problems come from Thunderbird version, not from Debian.

I have 2 problems with the new dialog windows of Print, Save as, Open etc.

1. e.g. when I click on "Print", the dialog window opens and my problem is the position of the Button "Print". Now it is in the upper right corner and always before it was in the lower right corner. Can I change this position of the buttons?

2. e.g. when I click on "Save as", the dialog window opens and my problem is that the field of the filename in the upper middle is much too small in width. Before when this field was at the lower middle to right, there was much more width for the filename. Can I change the width of this field?

All in all my both problems are with dialog windows, which I think are Mozilla / Thunderbird / Firefox exclusive, because in other apps there are dialog windows which look completely different. Is there a way to change the entire "optic" of the dialog windows or maybe I can prevent Mozilla apps from using their own dialogs and use my system standard dialogs?

Best regards
creator: koppenhagen

title: Lesezeichen werden automatisch angelegt
content:
Guten Tag lieber Support,

beim Erstellen eines Lesezeichens (Strg+D aus dem aktuellen Tag heraus) wird dieses nach ~3 Sekunden automatisch angelegt.

Das Verhalten dieser Funktion ist äußerst(!) ärgerlich. Es kann vorkommen, dass sich der Dialog direkt vor dem Anfassen mit der Maus bzw. dem Erkennen / sehen / user action im Bereich des Fensters einfach schließt.

Das Lesezeichen wird dann zwar erstellt, aber in diesem use case muss es nochmal angefasst werden.

Könnt ihr bitte eine Möglichkeit schaffen, dieses automatische Speichern & Schließen-Funktion zu unterbinden? Sollte es schon eine Möglichkeit dafür geben, bin ich offen für Erklärung.

Beste Grüße!
creator: siegfried.reidel

title: Weird scaling issue
content:
I am experiencing a weird scaling issue on one of my monitors with Firefox. The whole firefox window looks as if it's scaled to high resolution mode. Not just zoom of the content, but the whole window, including the title, toolbars, etc.

Note that only happens on ONE monitor (I've tried this on total 6 monitors now), and it happens only on one Firefox Profile. If I use a new profile, the issue is gone. However, if I copy the profile folder to the newly created profile, the issue comes back.

Here is a screenshot of the two windows opened at the same time on the same screen. Right window is normal, and the left window is the scaled up version.

https://i.imgur.com/ikq00DA.png


I don't want to re-create my entire profile if I don't have to. Does anyone know what kind of setting/feature did this and how can I revert it? Since it does not happen on a different profile, and is replicable by copying the profile settings, it must be some kind of a firefox setting somewhere.

title: Logged into Firefox on new laptop, now Firefox on my desktop isn't saving cookies or history
content:
I have been using Firefox for years on my Mac Mini and MacBook Pro, sync has never been a problem.

Now I inherited a Dell laptop, after reinstalling Windows 11 I installed Firefox and logged into my account as normal, and then switched back to using my Mac Mini. The next time I closed and then later reopened Firefox on the Mac Mini, Firefox had logged me out of every website, forgot my entire browsing history, passwords, bookmarks, everything. Its all gone with the exception of 4 of my 16 links on Firefox Home.

So I spent an hour fighting MFA, etc. on the websites I use the most, only to close Firefox and have it log me out and forget everything again. That is now its behavior, it loses everything every time I close the app. It does remember my toolbar settings, and those same 4 links on Firefox Home. i rebooted the computer and the problem remains.

Firefox is still logged into my account, it just doesn't sync or remember anything. Doesn't save cookies, history, nothing. Every time i relaunch the app, Firefox home is back in its default state

I also still have an instance of Firefox open on my MBP, I am now deathly afraid of closing the app for worry it will do the same. I also am afraid of using Firefox on the Windows computer, I absolutely cannot break this more.

How do I fix this this quickly and prevent it from ever happening again? I am getting absolutely buried in computer problems at every turn right now and nothing's getting solved. Every fix for weeks not only fails, but inevitably creates a new problem and I'm sorry but I'm going a little crazy and I really need a break.

Thank you.
creator: VincentBrick

For example, I saw a post with a video on x.com, and the site was set to prohibit automatic video playback.
